title: ClearScrub Loan Application Schema
description: Standardized schema for extracting loan application data from various document formats

company.description: Information about the applicant business entity

legal_name.description: The official registered legal name of the business as it appears on incorporation documents, tax filings, and legal contracts

dba_name.description: Doing Business As name - the trade name or brand name under which the company operates if different from legal name

ein.description: Employer Identification Number - the 9-digit federal tax ID issued by the IRS
ein.x-extraction-instructions: Accept with or without hyphen. Normalize to XX-XXXXXXX format.

industry.description: The primary industry sector or business category in which the company operates

address_line1.description: Primary street address line including street number and street name

address_line2.description: Secondary address line for suite, apartment, floor, or unit numbers

application.description: Loan application financial information and owner details

business_structure.description: The legal structure or entity type of the business organization

years_in_business.description: How long the business has been operating, measured in years (can be decimal for partial years)
years_in_business.x-extraction-instructions: If date established is provided, calculate years from current date. If months given, convert to decimal years (e.g., 18 months = 1.5 years). If range given (e.g., '2-3 years'), use the midpoint (2.5).

number_of_employees.description: Total number of employees working for the business, including full-time, part-time, and owners

annual_revenue.description: Total gross revenue or sales for the most recent completed fiscal year, in US dollars. This field requires intelligent parsing as it may appear in many formats.
annual_revenue.x-extraction-instructions: SEMANTIC INTERPRETATION required. Parse flexibly: 1) ABBREVIATIONS (case insensitive): M/m/MM = million (×1,000,000), K/k = thousand (×1,000), B/b = billion (×1,000,000,000). Examples: '2M' → 2000000, '500k' → 500000, '$1.5M' → 1500000. 2) WRITTEN FORMS: 'two million' → 2000000, 'five hundred thousand' → 500000. 3) DECIMAL FORMATS: '2.5M' → 2500000. 4) RANGES: '500k-1M' → Use MAXIMUM value: 1000000. 5) CURRENCY: Strip all $, commas, spaces. 6) MONTHLY TO ANNUAL: If labeled as monthly, multiply by 12. OUTPUT: Pure numeric value.

requested_funding.description: The desired or requested dollar amount of funding. This is what the applicant is seeking, NOT what they will necessarily receive.
requested_funding.x-extraction-instructions: Same parsing rules as annual_revenue: strip $, commas, interpret abbreviations (K, M, B), handle ranges by taking maximum.

funding_purpose.description: The intended use or reason for the requested funding
x-alternate-labels: what will funds be used for

owner_1_name.description: Full name (first and last) of the primary business owner or guarantor
owner_1_name.x-extraction-instructions: If first_name and last_name are separate fields, concatenate with space. Format: [First] [Middle] [Last]. Omit middle if not present.

owner_1_ssn.description: Full Social Security Number of the primary owner (9 digits with hyphens)
owner_1_ssn.x-extraction-instructions: Extract the FULL 9-digit Social Security Number. Normalize to XXX-XX-XXXX format with hyphens. If provided without hyphens (123456789), add them.

owner_1_dob.description: Date of birth of the primary owner
owner_1_dob.x-extraction-instructions: Normalize all date formats to YYYY-MM-DD: MM/DD/YYYY → YYYY-MM-DD, MM-DD-YYYY → YYYY-MM-DD, 'November 10, 1984' → '1984-11-10', '11/10/1984' → '1984-11-10'. Date must be in the past and person must be at least 18 years old.

owner_1_ownership_pct.description: Percentage of business ownership held by primary owner (0-100)
owner_1_ownership_pct.x-extraction-instructions: If shown as decimal (0.5), multiply by 100 to get 50. If shown with % symbol (50%), strip the % and use the number. Store as number between 0-100.

owner_1_address.description: Complete formatted mailing address of the primary owner
owner_1_address.x-extraction-instructions: Concatenate address fields: [address_line1], [city], [state] [zip]. If address_line2 exists: [address_line1] [address_line2], [city], [state] [zip]. Omit empty fields.

owner_1_phone.description: Primary contact phone number for owner 1
owner_1_phone.x-extraction-instructions: If multiple phone fields exist (cell_phone, home_phone, mobile, etc.), prioritize: 1) cell_phone/mobile_phone, 2) home_phone, 3) work_phone. Use first available.

owner_2_name.description: Full name of second owner or co-guarantor (if applicable)

owner_2_ssn.description: Full Social Security Number of second owner (9 digits with hyphens)
owner_2_ssn.x-extraction-instructions: Same rules as owner_1_ssn. Extract FULL 9 digits, normalize to XXX-XX-XXXX format.

owner_2_dob.description: Date of birth of second owner
owner_2_dob.x-extraction-instructions: Same normalization rules as owner_1_dob. Convert all formats to YYYY-MM-DD.

owner_2_ownership_pct.description: Percentage of business ownership held by second owner

owner_2_address.description: Complete formatted address of second owner

owner_2_phone.x-extraction-instructions: Same priority rules as owner_1_phone: prefer cell over home

confidence_score.description: Overall confidence score for the extraction (0.0 to 1.0)
